meanings.definition: A sudden forward thrust or motion
meanings.sent1: She made a quick lunge towards the ball.
meanings.sent2: The cat's lunge at the toy was swift and playful.
meanings.sent3: The clown's exaggerated lunge towards the cake made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His lunge for success was relentless and determined.
meanings.sent5: The lunge of the dancer was graceful and precise.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden forward thrust or movement
meanings.sent1: He lunged forward to catch the falling vase.
meanings.sent2: The player lunged for the finish line with all his might.
meanings.sent3: She lunged at the opportunity to showcase her talent.
meanings.sent4: The car suddenly lunged forward when the brakes failed.
meanings.sent5: The chef lunged for the falling pot before it hit the ground.

meanings.definition: A sudden forward movement in fencing or other sports
meanings.sent1: The fencer's lunge was swift and precise.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's lunge secured the winning point.
meanings.sent3: The exaggerated lunge in the race made the audience gasp.
meanings.sent4: Her lunge in the tennis match caught her opponent off guard.
meanings.sent5: The gymnast's lunge was a perfect display of balance and strength.
